fields.description:
The setting "Default language" is set to"English (United States)". If a user has the setting "Language" set to "Automatically detect browser setting" in its profile, this takes precedence and changes the language to whatever language the browser is installed with.

We would like to override users preferences.
fields.summary: Force English regardless of what users Preferences

fields.description: Customer wants to be able to add a workflow condition that blocks an issue to be transitioned if it has linked blocker issues that are not on "Closed" status. Similar to "Sub-Task Blocking Condition" condition on the workflow transitions.
fields.summary: Blocker Issue condition on workflow's transition

fields.description:
I am trying to connect JIra using Zephyr Cloud REST API (
[https://prod-api.zephyr4jiracloud.com/connect/)] using nodejs  And facing issue like  "UNABLE_TO_GET_ISSUER_CERT_LOCALLY".
 
Is certificate mandatory to install in my application? If yes Help how to download the certificate ?
   (or)
Is there any way to connect jira cloud with out configuring certificate in my application
fields.summary: I am connecting to JIra using   Zephyr Cloud REST API using nodejs,gettting this error "UNABLE_TO_GET_ISSUER_CERT_LOCALLY". Is there any way to connect jira cloud  with  out certificate

fields.description: An external company is sending us tickets via their (cloud hosted) jira system. We would like to integrate their tickets into our Jira software so that we can see the actual status of the tickets also in our system or can update their tickets via our system.
fields.summary: Integration of Jira tickets from another cloud hosted Jira

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to remove group from Project Role and People page when the alphabet case is not matching with the group name. This is happen when admin adding the group from *Assign Default Groups* for Project Role configuration.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a group name *Abc*
 # Then, go to *System > Project Roles*
 # Click *Manage Default Members* for any roles.
 # Click *Edit* for Default Groups.
 # Then, type in *abc* for *Add group(s) to project role:* section.
 # Then, try to remove the group at the right side by ticking the group and click *Remove*

h3. Expected Results

The group will be removed.
h3. Actual Results

The group can't be removed. Even when return to view the roles setting, under *Default Groups* it will display is lowercase letter as per key in during step 5.
 This will affect for *People* page too if the group already added to the People configuration.
h3. Workaround

  No workaround present at the moment.
fields.summary: Unable to remove group from Project Role and People

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a user places a custom field on a screen and has edit rights on that issue, the custom field will no use all the available space on the screen
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Create a custom field and add it to a screen.
 Create issue with custom field, enter a long line of text that will use up the full length of available text space.
 Open the issue
h3. Expected Results

Custom text field should use all the available space on screen from left to right
h3. Actual Results

Text is displayed in box that is only 400px wide

If the user is not in a group that has edit rights, the screen will use all the whitespace. The screenshots make it clear
h3. Workaround

No

!with_edit_rights1.jpg|thumbnail! !without_edit_rights1.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Custom multi line text fields not using full width of screen when user has edit rights

fields.description: If you follow the link https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/jira-system-administration-818579047.html, all links in the documentation lead to an incomplete page.
fields.summary: The Jira System Administration KB is incomplete

fields.description:
Hi,

Vendor tried to transition an issue from in progress to resolved via the REST API, but got the error below.

{noformat}
Could not move to history step for #96068: root cause: while inserting: [GenericEntity:OSHistoryStep][owner,][caller,addon_com.k15t.backbone.backbone-issue-sync][dueDate,null][stepId,7][actionId,751][finishDate,2018-02-12 23:02:37.648][id,10000][startDate,2018-02-06 14:19:34.693][entryId,96068][status,null] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO public.OS_HISTORYSTEP (ID, ENTRY_ID, STEP_ID, ACTION_ID, OWNER, START_DATE, DUE_DATE, FINISH_DATE, STATUS, CALLER) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint \"pk_os_historystep\"\n Detail: Key (id)=(10000) already exists.))
{noformat}

Afterwards, he tried to perform the action via the UI and it also failed with the same error (see screenshot).

A [solution|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/unable-to-transition-workflow-due-to-duplicate-entry-error-373260771.html?_ga=2.162913788.1530234755.1518418207-125975857.1504679129] was found but only applicable to server.

Can you please apply the fix in cloud as well?

Support ticket: https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/DEVHELP-968

Cheers,
Anne Calantog
fields.summary: Unable to Transition Workflow due to Duplicate entry error

fields.description:
I, as JIRA user, would like to be able to be logged in the same instance with two different accounts, similar to the way Office, Google, and lots of other sites.

Workaround
Use more than one browser.
fields.summary: Logged in Two Account Same Instance Same Time

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Issue created via email can use a deleted issue type.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Create an Incoming Mail Handler and set to create an issue as issue type *Task*.
- Delete the issue type *Task* for the project.
- Send an email to JIRA

h3. Expected Results
JIRA should not allow to create the issue via email.

h3. Actual Results
A new issue is created with the issue type set to *Task*. Editing the issue will set the issue type to a valid one.

h3. Notes
When deleting an issue type for a project, JIRA should check the mail handler configurations.
fields.summary: Issue can be created via email with a deleted issue type

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When creating an issue via email, required fields for a JIRA issue can be by-passed. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Set up a field configuration with a required field and assign to a project.
- Set up an Incoming mail handler to create an issue on the same project
- Send an email to JIRA

h3. Expected Results
JIRA should not allow the issue to be created.

h3. Actual Results
Issue created on the project with an empty value for the required field
 
h3. Notes
JIRA should have the option in the mail handler configuration to handle the required fields upon creation via email.
fields.summary: Required field can be by passed by creating issue via email

fields.description:
*Problem Description*

We still do not have clear steps for creating this scenario. But we're seeing cases where the JQL Statement like the one below, is returning wrong results (issues that were not in the given status at the given date).

*Steps to Reproduce* (when affected):

# Perform a  JQL search as the example below{code} Status was "statusname" on "14/feb/2018" {code}
# Check search results

*Expected behaviour:*
JQL Should only show issues which were on the given status on the date provided.

*Actual behaviour:*
Ocasionally issues that were not on the given status by that date will appear as search results.

*Workaround*

None at the moment
fields.summary: JQL Statement "Status WAS" is considering wrong dates

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Having a post-function of Zendesk in the workflow step (notify Zendesk support) the notification of the transition is sent without the comment in the email content.

Steps to Reproduce

# Add the post-function _notify Zendesk support_ in a transition on workflow step
# Transition an issue and add a comment during the transition (that has the post-function)
# Verify the notification email

h3. Expected Results

The email notification has the comment in its content

h3. Actual Results

The email notification didn't bring the comment on its content

h3. Notes

It happens when adding a comment during a transition that has this post-functions. Directly comments and other transitions of the workflow aren't impacted

h3.Workaround
fields.summary: Notification email don't have the comment on its content

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The announcement banner feature has been removed in the New Jira Experience. However, the banner still appears on certain pages.
h3. Environment
 - Atlassian Cloud
 - New Jira Experience

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add an announcement banner in the Old Interface. 
 # Switch to the New Jira Experience.
 # Go to a Dashboard where you can see an issue. (This can be from any gadgets such as "Assigned to me", etc)
 # Hover over an issue, and click on the ". . ." -> "Log Work"
 # You will be redirected to a page to Log Work for the issue

h3. Expected Results

On the redirected page, the announcement banner should not be seen.
h3. Actual Results

On the redirected page, the announcement banner can be seen.

!banner-2.png|width=783,height=200!
h3. Workaround
 - If it is still possible to switch back to the Old Interface, switch back, and remove the announcement banner.
 - If it is not possible to switch back, and you would like to remove the announcement banner, please reach out to Support.
fields.summary: Announcement Banner appears in certain pages in the New Jira Experience

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a user is viewing the issues screen in a project, and switches to another project and then switches back, it will not "remember" that it was on the issues view. It does not happen with other views e.g. reports 

 

h3. Environment 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

#Navigate to a project

#Select *issues* side navigation

#Move to another project

#Move back to first project, it will no longer be in the issues view

h3. Expected Results
Should return to last view in project, in this cause *issues*

h3. Actual Results 
Returns to last view that was not *issues* for example, if you were on reports prior to that, will return there
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround (If there is no workaround directly say so)
Functionality is still there, user needs to manually select issues
fields.summary: User not landing on issues view when returning to project

fields.description:
h3. Expected Behavior
Use current project roles or warn administrators about the creation of new roles.

h3. Actual Behavior
When a CSV import defines a new project or you create a new project during an import from an external system (Github, for example), the "Developers" project role is re-created when it had been renamed or deleted earlier on. The administrator is not informed of so by any means.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Rename or delete a default project role;
# Import a CSV file that defines a new project (could contain just the project name, key and an issue summary); *or* create a new project when importing from an external system;
# Notice the default roles are re-created; 

h3. Workaround
At this point, there's no workaround nor fix available for this.

h3. Additional Notes
You can confirm the creation date of the project role through the SQL query on the projectrole table.
fields.summary: CSV or External System Import automatically creates "Developers" project role

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When transitioning issues on the pop-up issue view in Jira Boards, it's not possible to edit some fields and add comments in the transition screen

h3. Customer Impact

h3. Environment
* Business or Software project that has a Screen associated with a transition. For example, Resolve issue Screen added to the last transition

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a Jira Board that is using the new experience
# Click on an issue to open the pop-up detail view
# Perform a transition that has a screen associated with it

h3. Expected Results
The transition screen pops up and it's possible to fill all fields

h3. Actual Results
The transition screen pops up but it's not possible to add comments or to edit some fields. In general, it seems like only drop-down fields work as expected.

When trying to edit a comment or an edit a field in the transition screen, nothing happens. You click on the field and try to type something and nothing appears on the screen.

*Application logs:*

h3. Notes
If you do the same operation outside the board in a regular issue view, it's possible to add comments and edit all fields

h3.Workaround

Perform the transition from outside the board
fields.summary: It's not possible to edit fields in the transition screen when transitioning through the board

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the Slack integration with Jira (jirabot) does not support connecting to *Shared channels*, which is a new feature by Slack, where users can connect one workspace to another workspace.
 
More information here: [https://get.slack.help/hc/en-us/articles/115004151203-Create-shared-channels-on-a-workspace-beta-]
 
h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the ability to integrate jirabot in Shared channels.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to integrate Slack with Jira (jirabot) in Shared channels

fields.description:
Problem

Jira UI resizes the workflows buttons according with the transition name length, but on long transitions, it will crop the transition name.

 

Suggestion

Add an option that lets the button's length increase accordingly with the transition name, even for long transitions
fields.summary: Add an option to resize workflow button's length

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On the new JIRA experience, components does not display properly when used on the Y-axis of a Two Dimensional Filter Statistics Gadget

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup a Two Dimensional Filter Statistics Gadget
# Set the Y-axis to Components
# View the gadget in the dashboard

h3. Expected Results

Components text should be displayed properly.

 !old-ui.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

Components text overlap with the image.

 !new-ui.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: two dimensional filter statistics does not display components properly

fields.description:
h3. Summary

There's a possibility where an import failed due to malformed XML error but there's no issue with the XML. It happens randomly and it has higher chance to fail with big XML file.

Errors below were thrown while using the exact same backup data. These were on separate import runs.
{noformat}
Error parsing export file. Your export file is invalid. This may be due to a CDATA bug in older versions of Jira (http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-4980). Exception is org.xml.sax.SAXParseException; lineNumber: 2150534; columnNumber: 59; The element type "body" must be terminated by the matching end-tag "</body>".


Error parsing export file. Your export file is invalid. This may be due to a CDATA bug in older versions of Jira (http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-4980). Exception is org.xml.sax.SAXParseException; lineNumber: 3257277; columnNumber: 135; Attribute name "updatea04-20" associated with an element type "Action" must be followed by the ' = ' character.

{noformat}
h3. Steps to reproduce

(i) The occurrence is inconsistent.
 # Create a backup from a Jira Cloud instance - without attachments.
 # Import to another instance.

h3. Workaround

Run the import again.

(i) If errors occur multiple times. Please contact Atlassian Support for further assistance at [https://support.atlassian.com/contact]
fields.summary: Import failed with malformed XML error

fields.description:
We have hundreds of projects and the number is growing. 
We would to be able to organize projects so that they are easy to navigate in Jira.
Ideally multiple hierarchies like a relational database.
fields.summary: Organize Projects in Hierarchy

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA does not accept {{archive=true}} option on the create version rest api call 


h3. Steps to Reproduce

Create a version via a rest api call with the {{archive=true}} option.

{code}
curl --request POST \
  -u <email_address>:<password> \
  --header 'Accept: application/json' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '
    {
      "description": "An excellent version",
      "name": "New Version 3",
      "archived":true,
      "released":true,
      "project": "TEST",
      "projectId": 10002
    }' \
  --url 'https://cloud.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/version'
{code}

h3. Expected Results

Output should be : 

{code}
{
   "self":"https://cloud.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/version/10004",
   "id":"10004",
   "description":"An excellent version",
   "name":"New Version 3",
   "archived":true,         <------------- Archive should be returned as true.
   "released":true,
   "projectId":10002
}
{code}

On the web interface, the created version should be *archived*.

h3. Actual Results

Output :

{code}
{
   "self":"https://cloud.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/version/10004",
   "id":"10004",
   "description":"An excellent version",
   "name":"New Version 3",
   "archived":false,         <------------- Archived returned as false.
   "released":true,
   "projectId":10002
}
{code}

On the web interface, the created version is not *archived*.

 
h3.Workaround

After creating the version, do another rest api call to update the archive option of the version that was previously created. 

{code}
  curl --request PUT \
  -u <email_address>:<password> \
  --header 'Accept: application/json' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '
    {
      "self":"https://cloud.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/version/10004",
      "id": "10004",
      "archived": true,
      "released": false
    }' \
  --url 'https://cloud.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/version/10004'
{code}

Output :
{code}
{
   "self":"https://cloud.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/version/10004",
   "id":"10004",
   "description":"An excellent version",
   "name":"New Version 3",
   "archived":true,    <----- Archived is now set to true.
   "released":false,
   "projectId":10002
}
{code}

On the web interface, the version will be set to *archived*.
fields.summary: Archive option not working for version create REST API

fields.description:
h3. Summary

User is receiving bounce emails when sending email to Jira Core configured default mail handler, for example:
{code:java}
This message could not be delivered.
Action: failed
Final-Recipient: rfc822; jira@test123.atlassian.net
Original-Recipient: rfc822; jira@test123.atlassian.net
Diagnostic-Code: smtp; 550 5.1.1 Mailbox does not exist
Status: 5.1.1
{code}
 

This happens in case there are more than 1 Mail Server configured in Jira Core ('Incoming email' section) that has 'host' specified as 'mailstore':

!default_mailstore.JPG!
h3. Expected Results

Email is received by Jira and processed successfully
h3. Actual Results

Bounce is received 3 hours after email is sent
h3. Workaround

This situation may happen in case there are Mail Servers configured from Jira Service Desk, name of such Mail Server is automatically generated and will be like:
{code:java}
Mail server for <project_name>@<instance_name>.atlassian.net. Created by JIRA Service Desk.
{code}
 Make sure there are no Mail Handlers configured for this mail server. If so, remove such Jira Service Desk Mail Server.
fields.summary: Receiving bounce when sending email to configured default Jira Core mail handler

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Boards in Software projects are not loading within JIRA Cloud. Currently displaying a blank page and showing numerous error messages in the Console.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Software Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Browse to any Software Project utilizing a board (Backlog, Active Sprints, Etc)
# Observe the issue

h3. Expected Results
Boards should load and display correctly

h3. Actual Results
The Board is not displaying, showing a blank page. The Sidebar is still usable and clickable.
 
h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Boards are not loading in JIRA projects

fields.description:
In the section "Evaluar esta página" when you press to send without choosing one of the options "evalué" shows, with bad typing.

Should be "evalúe" in the place of "evalué".
fields.summary: Translation Error - Spanish

fields.description: I, as JIRA Administrator, would like to have the ability, to configure my JIRA to be able to assign issues to an group.
fields.summary: Ability to Assign Issue to Group

fields.description: I, as JIRA Administrator, would like to be able to disable email notifications for a user without removing them from the project.
fields.summary: Disable email notifications for a user

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When users are trying to edit an issue through /secure/EditIssue!default.jspa?id= , the attachment fails to upload. 

h3. Expected Results
Attachment must be uploaded

h3. Actual Results
The file is not uploaded and receive an error message in the browser console
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
Edit the issue through the usual Edit screen by clicking _Edit_ in the issue

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Copy and paste the url /secure/EditIssue!default.jspa?id= to your instance
# Update the id
# Add an attachment and try to _Upload_.
fields.summary: When editing an issue in jira using "/secure/EditIssue!default.jspa?id=", attachment upload fails

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Officially, there is no archiving of projects in JIRA. There is an open [Feature Request|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-1450] that directs admins to [this workaround|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/archiving-a-project-861253768.html], which consists of removing all permissions from everyone. In the previous UI, a hidden project would only be accessible to admins when they access JIRA's settings (Cog icon -> projects), but wouldn't be accessible through trivial navigation (non settings screens). With the new UI, admins who have the "Administer JIRA" global permission can view a "hidden" project through non settings screens. This is misleading because when an admin click on the hidden's project name, they are greeted with a "Project not found" screen.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Archive a project;
# Click on JIRA's icon on the sidebar (top left corner);
# Click on the archived project.

h3. Expected Results
* As the admin is not on a setting screen, the archived project should not be visible.

h3. Actual Results
* The archived project is visible on a trivial navigation screen.

 !Hidden project showing on normal navigation.png|thumbnail! 

 !Project not found screen.png|thumbnail! 

* The archived project should only be viewable on a setting screen.

 !Project settings.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround(s)
* There is none, although it should be stated that this only happens to who has the "Administer JIRA" global permission. To other users, the project is not visible at all.

 !non admin hidden project.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: "Hidden" projects are showing to admins on a non setting screen.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the JQL (fixVersion in unreleasedVersions() OR fixVersion = EMPTY) to search for issues, it throws an exception.
{noformat} 
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: You can not construct an OrClause without any child clauses.
	at com.atlassian.query.clause.OrClause.<init>(OrClause.java:19) [jira-api-1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.query.optimizer.ClauseCollapsingDbSearchJqlOptimizer$1.visit(ClauseCollapsingDbSearchJqlOptimizer.java:67) [classes/:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.query.optimizer.ClauseCollapsingDbSearchJqlOptimizer$1.visit(ClauseCollapsingDbSearchJqlOptimizer.java:45) [classes/:?]
	at com.atlassian.query.clause.OrClause.accept(OrClause.java:28) [jira-api-1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.query.optimizer.AbstractDbSearchJqlOptimizer$AbstractOptimizingVisitor.lambda$visit$0(AbstractDbSearchJqlOptimizer.java:27) [classes/:?]
	at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$3$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:193) [?:1.8.0_131]
	at java.util.ArrayList$ArrayListSpliterator.forEachRemaining(ArrayList.java:1374) [?:1.8.0_131]
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.copyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:481) [?:1.8.0_131]
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.wrapAndCopyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:471) [?:1.8.0_131]
	at java.util.stream.ReduceOps$ReduceOp.evaluateSequential(ReduceOps.java:708) [?:1.8.0_131]
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.evaluate(AbstractPipeline.java:234) [?:1.8.0_131]
	at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline.collect(ReferencePipeline.java:499) [?:1.8.0_131]
{noformat}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Search for issues
# Use the following JQL: (fixVersion in unreleasedVersions() OR fixVersion = EMPTY)
# JIRA will return: *Error occurred communicating with the server. Please reload the page and try again.*
# Refreshing the page will get 500 error with the stack trace above.

h3. Expected Results
* JIRA should look for EMPTY fixVersion or JIRA shouldn't pass the JQL(Green Ticked) (/)

h3. Actual Results
* JIRA throws an exception while trying to search using that JQL.
fields.summary: Using JQL fixVersion = EMPTY with an OrClause throws an exception

fields.description: I would like to have the side panel to be automatically collapsed when I am done with the selection instead of staying expanded.
fields.summary: Sidebar to be Automatically Collapsed
New Jira interface displays general pages within a Project unlike the old interface

fields.description:
Jira and hipchat integration rely on specific events (example: Transition). It would be great if the event scope could be widened to accommodate changes to the fields (example label change).

 !Screen Shot 2018-02-12 at 09.41.24.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Hipchat Notification on label change

fields.description:
h3. Reproduction steps:
 # Admin invites a new user to a Jira instance via user management
 # New user logs in, and goes through Jira onboarding
 # The first step is uploading a user avatar. User uploads avatar

h3. What should happen:

User Avatar is shown everywhere the current "default" avatar image is shown.
h3. What happens:

User Avatar shows up in Activity stream, but not in the User Profile page, nor on the top right "User" menu.
fields.summary: Uploading custom user avatar during user onboarding does not work correctly

fields.description:
Previous to the "New JIRA Experience" Quick Filters were aligned to the top of a board and quickly accessible for standups.

Now the new version displays quick filters as a dropdown which is cumbersome. 

This suggestion is to revert to the previous behavior that doesn't use a dropdown for quick filters or add an option to display the quick filters as a static list or dropdown (perhaps in the quick filters section of board settings?).

Thank you for your time and consideration.
fields.summary: Replace Quick Filters Dropdown with Previously Implemented Static List

fields.description:
h4. Problem:
 * By accessing any instance's about page, it is possible to see that the software versions are not exactly updated.
 * This might cause confusion as it leads people to believe that the software is not in its latest version

h4. Steps to reproduce:
 # Go to the URL https://<instance>.atlassian.net/secure/AboutPage.jspa
 # Check versions
  !Screen Shot 2018-02-09 at 15.56.30.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Proposed solution:
 * Maintain this page updated with the software version release date
fields.summary: Product versions in the About Page are not up to date

fields.description: I, as JIRA Administrator, would like to have the feature to copy issue types.
fields.summary: Copy Issue Type

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After '[Zephyr took the reins of Capture for Jira|https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/capture#zephyr-faq]', apparently, it doesn't create fields it used to create:
* Capture for JIRA URL	
* Capture for JIRA browser
* Capture for JIRA jQuery version	
* Capture for JIRA operating system	
* Capture for JIRA screen resolution	
* Capture for JIRA user agent 

However, some instances still have those fields. If we don't have Zephyr's Capture installed, deleting these fields won't persist, as accessing a ticket recreates them.

This pollutes the Custom Field page.

If Zephyr's Capture is installed, deleting the fields does persist after accessing tickets.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure you have the old Custom Fields for Capture
# Don't have Zephyr Capture installed
# Delete the Custom Fields
# Access a ticket

h3. Expected Results
The fields remain deleted.

h3. Actual Results
They are recreated.

h3.Workaround
* Install a trial of Zephyr Capture
** *If you have already used the whole trial, installing the add-on will cause a license price update. Also, this time will count toward the trial, if you want to use it later*
* Delete all custom fields (though it's not clear, deleting them with this add-on installed prevent them from being recreated)
* Unsubscribe from Zephyr Capture
fields.summary: Capture custom fields cannot be deleted permanently

fields.description: User report that "Back to Project Button" is missing on some screens in the New Jira Experience Interface (that used to have it on the old interface) and would like to see it re-added, as this button was a time saver while working on his projects.
fields.summary: "Back to Project" Button re-added to the New Jira Experience

fields.description:
I, as JIRA Administrator, would like to configure the automation to send the link of the issue in the notification email.
This way, once received, I could click and go directly to the issue.
fields.summary: Link Issue in Notification Email

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, when admins are configuring a create screen, they can rearrange the "issue type" field.
When creating an issue, JIRA will ignore the position that the admin put the "issue type" field and will display this field in the second position from top to bottom.

h3. Suggested Solution
Remove the ability to rearrange the "issue type" field when configuring a create screen or, at least, place a banner warning admins that the position of this field won't be changed when configuring a create screen.

h3. Why this is important
Enhance the user experience. It is misleading to admins to have the ability to rearrange this field and realise it is not in the correct order when creating an issue.

h3. Workaround 
There is none.
fields.summary: Remove the rearrangement of "Issue type" field when configuring a create screen

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
Icons missing in Jira when users Zoom in using Safari browser. On the left bar the last 3 icons, "Change app", "Help" and "Profile and settings" are not visible hence their menus are unreachable

h3. *Environment*
* Jira Cloud
* Safari 11.0.3

h3. *Steps to reproduce*
# In Safari browser;
# Open Jira;
# Zoom in;
# Notice that the icons on the left bar are missing.


h3. *Expected Results*
The last icons should be displayed when Zoom in on a page.

h3. *Actual Results*
The last icons on the left bar are not on the page.

h3. *Notes*
Issue was reported to be reproducible only using Safari.

h3. *Workaround*
Users are recommended to use a different browser when they need to zoom in on a page, like Google Chrome.
fields.summary: Icons missing in Jira when users Zoom in using Safari browser

fields.description:
Please hide the add-ons (system users) from the assignable fields. There is an example of how they are seen when you click to assign issues.
 !Screen Shot 2018-02-09 at 09.39.59.png!
fields.summary: Hide add-ons from assignable users

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When accessing _Screens_ page in Jira administration, it is shown blank.

  !Blank_page.png|thumbnail!

 Error could be seen:
{code}
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Cannot find Screen with id 'xxxxx'.
{code}
h3. This is happening because one of the deleted screens is still associated to a _published_ workflow.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Associate existing screen to a _draft_ workflow (any transition).
 # Remove the screen (Jira will allow you to remove the screen only if related workflow is _draft)_
 # Publish workflow

h3. Expected Results

Jira shouldn't allow to remove screen that is associated to a _draft_ workflow
h3. Actual Results

Screen is removed even if it is still associated to a workflow 
h3. Workaround  
 # Open affected workflow, 'Screen' section of related transition will show "null".
 # Change "null" to any other existing screen.
fields.summary: Blank page is shown when accessing Screens in Jira administration when deleted screen is associated with a workflow

fields.description:
* To set up a board, you must first create a saved issue view, and order ASC by Rank
 * Create a board from that saved view
 * Click the 'View in Issue Navigator' button for your backlog
 ** Works as expected: issue view opens with your view's query entered
 * Now click the 'View in Issue Navigator' button for a specific sprint
 ** Expected: issue view opens with your view's query AND that sprint
 ** Actual: issue view opens with{color:#FF0000} just the sprint{color} as the filter
 * Now apply a quick filter, and click the 'View in Issue Navigator' button for your backlog again
 **  Expected: issue view opens with your view's query in addition to the applied quick filters
 ** Actual: issue view opens with j{color:#FF0000}ust the original view's query{color} applied
fields.summary: 'View in Issue Navigator' button on agile board should apply filters in issue view

fields.description:
*Summary*
After trying to remove a user, that uses special characters in its username, from the watcher list, it gets populated back on page reload.

*Environment*

Steps to Reproduce
# create a user using special characters ('+' for example)
# add this user to the watchers' list on any issue
# remove this user from the watchers' list
# reload the page
# user is back on the watchers' list

*Expected Results*
The user is removed permanently from the watchers' list.

*Actual Results*
The user appears again in the watchers' list after reloading the page

*Workaround*
Do not use special characters
fields.summary: Username using special character can't be deleted from watchers list

fields.description:
Since the new update, I find myself wanted to break something every time I need to do multiple quick updates on a ticket. 

Whenever the "Changes saved" notification comes up, it covers 3 buttons, one of which is very important (the More Options "···" one). So, I have to click to close the notification before I can make the next change. It is *very* annoying.

!JIRA.png!

My suggestion would be to move it to the center of the page, where there are no buttons that can be covered. Or even move it further up from where it currently is, so that it sits at the very top (even at the top edge) of the page and not further down, where it covers the buttons.

Also, it can be a lot quicker. After all, people don't read it. You just see something green quickly pop up and disappear which means "yay! no error. change saved". The current notification is painfully slow to come in and go away.

Personally, I wouldn't be opposed to getting rid of it completely. 

Please! I beg you. At least move the damn thing!  :)
fields.summary: Move "Changes Saved" notificaiton

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In some instances, when importing a CSV file with sub-tasks, the sub-task does not include the parent key in its breadcrumb

If we import a parent and a sub-task, the sub-task won't have a breadcrumb to the parent. If we create a sub-task manually, it will.

This is the parent, created via CSV:
!TW3-1.png|thumbnail!

Notice it has 2 sub-task, one created via CSV and another manually.

This is the sub-task created via CSV:
!TW3-7.png|thumbnail!

This is the one created in UI, you can see it has the parent in breadcrumb:
!TW3-8.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create and import a CSV file containing a parent and a sub-task
{code}
IssueID,Parent ID,Issue Type,Summary
1,,Story,Story
2,1,Sub-task,Sub Task 1 - Imported via CSV
{code}
# Create another sub-task of the imported parent

h3. Expected Results
Both parents have the parent in their breadcrumbs.

h3. Actual Results
The issue imported via CSV doesn't.
 
h3. Notes
*This is not happening to all Jira Cloud applications*

h3.Workaround
None so far.
fields.summary: CSV import may break parent/sub-task relation

fields.description: I, as JIRA user, would like to have the ability to create an custom field, with the functionality of attachment.
fields.summary: Add Custom Field with Attachment Functionality

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users connected to a Google Drive account cannot navigate through a long list of files/folders when trying to attach files to issues.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a long list of files/folders in your Google Drive.
# Access an instance and create a test issue.
# Under *Attachments*, click on *browse* and choose *Google Drive*.
# Check the list of folders.

h3. Expected Results

It should show all user's foldels.

h3. Actual Results

It does not show all the folders.

h3.Workaround

No workarounds.
fields.summary: Cannot navigate through a long list of Google Drive files/folders when attaching files to issues

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition  

 

The Jira Mobile app does not have the ability to add request participants to issues. Either whilst creating or for existing issues.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add the field *Request Participants* on issues for Jira Mobile.

h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Jira Mobile cannot add or edit request participants

fields.description: As a JIRA administrator, I'd like to have a way on the integration UI to configure the integration in a way that it sends a notification to a specific Slack channel when a specific field is updated.
fields.summary: JIRA For Slack integration: Send a notification to a channel when a field is updated

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the new UI, it is not possible to remove project shortcuts as described in the article below. The pencil icon is not displayed.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/project-shortcuts-765593117.html

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using the new UI, go to a project and create a shortcut, as described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/project-shortcuts-765593117.html]
# Refresh the page

h3. Expected Results
The pencil icon is visible to allow shortcut deletion

h3. Actual Results
The pencil icon appears while the page is loading and disappears when the page is completed loaded

 !Screen Shot 2018-02-07 at 9.27.28 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes


h3.Workaround
# If it is possible to disable the new UI, disable it 
# Go to the related project
# Next to the shortcut, click on the gray arrow
# Click *delete*
fields.summary: In the new UI, it is not possible to delete project shortcuts to repositories

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The project picker dropdown menu doesn't show all projects, it stops after a certain number of them (sort of like the "first page" of the drop down items)
h3. Environment

A Jira cloud instance with a high number of projects (over 45 at least)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Try and create a new ticket.
 # Try and scroll down to see available projects.

h3. Expected Results

A list of all projects
h3. Actual Results

Only the first 45 or so projects

!adg3.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Typing the project's name still works fine and the bug doesn't happen on the old UI, only on the New Jira Experience.

!adg2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: When creating an issue, cannot select all projects on the dropdown list

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Select list (single choice) custom fields are being listed as group custom field when adding notifications in the notification scheme.

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud and Jira Server.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Select list (single choice) custom field;
# In a notification scheme, click on add in any notificaiton;
# Check the *Group Custom Field Value*;
# The field you've just created is going to be listed as an option, even though it is not a group custom field.

h3. Expected Results
The new field should not be listed.

h3. Actual Results
The field is listed in the *Group Custom Field Value*.

h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Select list (single choice) custom field being listed as group custom field

fields.description: I, as JIRA user, would like to have the feature to use the whitespace padding trim() function.
fields.summary: Add trim() Function to JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the new issue view screen if the profile language is set to another language besides English, the Story Point field is not accepting the comma[,] decimal separator.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Set the profile language as Dansk (Danmark), German, French, or Portuguese, for example
# View the issue in the backlog and edit the Story Point field
# Enter any value separated by a comma or punctuation

h3. Expected Results

Story point field should accept comma[,] separator if the profile language used uses a comma as a decimal separator.
h3. Actual Results

Validation failed error will appear as shown in the screenshot below:

!Story Point.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Option 1: Edit the field in the old Issue view (*may no longer be applicable*)
Option 2: Switch the language settings to English in your *Personal Settings*.
fields.summary: Story Points field doesn't accept decimal separator when using different language settings

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user has a transition to the same status with a screen attached to it, by right a screen should pop up with all the fields on it. In this case when the user accesses the new issue detail view, and they transition to the statuses, the screen will not appear.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a workflow and add a transition to the same status
# Now go to your board on any project the workflow is being associated with
# Click on an issue on the board and the new issue detail view will appear
# Click on any issue and try transitioning to the same status with the screen attached to it.
# The screen which is being associated with the status will not appear

h3. Expected Results
The screen would appear when the status is being transitioned to its own status

h3. Actual Results
The screen does not appear

h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Transitioning to the same status with a screen in the new Issue Detail View

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Jira instance is not accessible.


h3. Steps to Reproduce

#Try to login to Jira instance

h3. Expected Results

Login is successful

h3. Actual Results

Jira is not accessible and error is shown:
{code}
HTTP Status 500 - Unable to load values for CacheKey[entityName=jira.properties,entityId=1] 
{code}

The following can be seen in the browser:

 !JiraDown.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

Please subscribe to our Status Page incident update for this incident:
https://status.atlassian.com/incidents/515ngj361lx7
fields.summary: Jira Cloud instance is not accessible, showing 500 error

fields.description:
Problem
Jira doesn't have a log of issues shared via the button at the top of the page.

Suggestion
There should be a way to track with who the issue has been shared.
fields.summary: Issue shared - Log tracking
Search query doesn't distinguish between a space and an underscore

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* When adding _post functions_ to a workflow transition, it is possible to choose the "*Copy Value From Other Field*" function. 
* This function allows you select the *Status* field as the one to be copied, which +should not be allowed+, as this field does not behave as a regular Jira field and such operation could result in an inconsistency in the database tables
* "Status" also represents the position of an issue in its workflow. For further information, check [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-statuses-resolutions-and-priorities-776636333.html]
* We recommend to create another post function specifically for the status change. (to apply for the case: Sub Tasks Transitions upon Parent Issues Transitioning.)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create project > Edit the workflow > Add the post-function *"Copy Value From Other Field"* on the Create transition
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Create a Task 
# Create a subtask
# Check the subtask status
# Change the status of the Task to *In Progress*
# Check the subtask status again

h3. Expected Results
* subtask status changes to *In Progress*

h3. Actual Results
* subtask status remains *To Do*

h3. Proposed solution
* We recommend removing the field *Status* from the available options 

h3.Workaround
* JIRA Misc Workflow Extensions third part app
* Automation Lite for Jira third part app (free)
fields.summary: "Copy Value From Other Field" post-function should not include "Status" among choices

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Search page shows an error informing the status is not valid for the project.
h3. Environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create new project
 # Add a new status on the project's workflow and publish it
 # Go to the search page
 # Select the new project
 # On *Status* dropdown there won't be listed the new status

h3. Expected Results

All statuses related to the project are available.
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
The status 'XXXXX' is not valid for your current project...
{noformat}
!Screen Shot 2018-02-06 at 6.08.11 PM.png|thumbnail! 
!Screen Shot 2018-02-06 at 6.08.57 PM.png|thumbnail!
!Screen Shot 2018-02-06 at 6.09.33 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

h3. Workaround
- Create a copy of the workflow scheme and associate with the project
fields.summary: Missing status while creating filter

fields.description: <this should be deleted / closed>
fields.summary: <this should be deleted / closed>

fields.description:
We use import to create our Epics & Stories because we use so many fields.  However, one of the things we can't import is the SPRINT ID.  This is truly painful to enter 40 stories, and then to manually move them into the proper sprint based.

As so many users have raised this has a "how do i" type question in the past 3+ years, why don't you fix this?  I don't have admin rights, so I can't look up a sprint id.  the sprint isn't active, so i can't "figure it out" by using a work around based on the URL.  

In this day and age, why should I need a work around? Why can't I use the sprint name, and then when importing the sprint name + project makes it unique.
fields.summary: Empower your users to Import Sprint NAME from CSV

fields.description:
Basically, when looking at a board, it's very hard to see to whom each story is assigned once it has sub-tasks.

We basically see the following template:
"> [Story/Issue/Improvement logo] [ISSUE REFERENCE] [Status] [Sub-tasks count] [Issue title]"

It would be really helpful (and rather easy to implement I guess) if we could have the assignee's Avatar between the ">" and the "[Story logo]" or somewhere around there.
fields.summary: Cannot see to whom stories are assigned to in boards

Possibility to visually customize issue body and comment. It would allow differentiate between comments made by humans and automated tools. The most optimal would be possibility to change colors of comment borders and/or background color.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, "WAS" JQL operator will search for issues based of the issue's history. For example, when an issue is assigned to a user during issue creation, the *issue history* will not record any changes done to the Assignee field. With that, "Assignee was currentUser()" will not return this issue in the result.

h3. Suggested Solution
Improve "Was" JQL operator to be able to search for issues when certain fields are not included in *Issue history*.
fields.summary: Improve "Was" JQL operator

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The fields in the new issue detailed view can't be customizable in terms of hiding the fields

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be great to give users the option of customizing the fields in the new issue detail view

h3. Why this is important

In more scenarios, the user would have many fields, and the user would have to keep scrolling down to have a look at the fields. This is troublesome.


h3. Workaround 

No workaround
fields.summary: Configurable fields for new Issue Detailed View

fields.description: Changes made to comment payload as reported in (https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/ACJIRA-1225\) has made it impossible to retrieve unique Id (custom field). Webhook event should include custom fields.
fields.summary: Include Custom Field in new webhook events

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At the moment, users cannot disable the popup notification to favorite the dashboard if the dashboard isn't a favorite yet.

 !Dashboard notification.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users to disable favorite dashboard notifications.

h3. Why this is important
 
Enhance the user experience.

h3. Workaround 

If you favorite the dashboard, the notification will not show anymore for that dashboard.
fields.summary: Allow users to disable favorite dashboard notifications

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The team uses the JIRA calculated Sprints to schedule their future work but they have a fixed start date for their Sprints. Every Monday for example.
The Portfolio calculated Sprints are not editable and will always start at the end of the previous Sprint and have a fixed number of days that is calculated.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add the ability to either create JIRA future Sprints through Portfolio or to edit the calculated sprints information like name, duration, and dates.

h3. Why this is important

Some teams depend on the Sprint dates to arrange their scheduling and this makes things complicated.
 
h3. Workaround 

Create future Sprints in your issue source and have one of the plan issues assigned to it.
This will make the Sprint appear in Portfolio and you should be able to edit its dates in JIRA.
fields.summary: Ability to edit calculated Sprints data

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the present scenario, users can configure text in the custom fields but cannot add any logos/pictures.
 !Custom_fields_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
The possibility to add a picture/logo to the text in the custom field (for Lists alone), similar to the fields where you can configure images also in the priorities section.
 !View_Priorities.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: To add Pictures/Logos across in custom fields

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Long custom field names are currently displayed on multiple lines.

!Field names too long for display.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow column size configurations to allow the field name to be displayed on a single line.
h3. Why this is important

It is possible to define long custom field names but they are not allowed to be displayed on a single line.
fields.summary: Allow column size configuration for long field names

fields.description: I, as JIRA Administrator, would like to have the feature of Automation on Business Projects.
fields.summary: Automation on Business Projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

User has multiple statuses with the % character in the name. Creating a standard JQL query you can search for these without issue.

However, when using the gadget Filter Count and you add counts/columns for statuses with % symbol, when you click on the figure in the gadget to display the search you receive a blank page with a search box and that is it, no menus.
h3. Environment

Jira Software
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create status with a % symbol in the name and assign to workflow
 # Add Count Filter gadget to dashboard
 # Select a search query and add counts for statuses with a percentage (%) in the name
 # Click on a count relating to a status with a percentage (%) symbol
 # You are taken to a broken search page with no issues or menus

h3. Expected Results

Clicking on the count should display an advanced search query with the issues that match the query
h3. Actual Results

When you click on the figure in the gadget to display the search for status with a (%) character you receive a blank page with a search box and that is it, no menus.

Also, a server error when you click on the top right ellipses.
{quote}Jira server could not be contacted. This may be a temporary glitch or the server is down.
{quote}
h3. Notes
 * Performing a standard JQL search for statuses with % symbol works as expected, it is the data that is passed by the gadget that throws this error
 * Similar error is shown when the character break has an ampersand sign(&) in it, instead of % symbol.

h3. Workaround

No workaround found
fields.summary: Filter Count gadget: count lookups based on status with any character break search when clicked

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Add-on pages are not fully rendered on Safari.
h3. Environment

Verified versions:
 * Jira: v1001.0.76.D20180202T213639
 * Safari Version 11.0.3 (13604.5.6)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use Safari
 # Open "Find new add-ons" "Manage add-ons"
 # Confirm pages are missing their expected contents

h3. Expected Results

Add-on pages are properly rendered.
h3. Actual Results

The page doesn't contain any expected add-on list.

!Screenshot 2018-02-05 17.04.02.png|thumbnail! !Screenshot 2018-02-05 17.04.32.png|thumbnail!

Console complains the following errors:
{code:none}
[Error] Error: A component definition of type "c" with the ID of "aui-dropdown2-trigger" already exists.
	set (aui.min.js:2:6991)
	l (aui.min.js:2:17594)
	(anonymous function) (aui.min.js:4:15063)
	Global Code (aui.min.js:4:22522)

[Error] ReferenceError: Can't find variable: __1a99a68c34e660050a094f87fb28903d
	(anonymous function) (aui-experimental.min.js:3:6807)
	Global Code (aui-experimental.min.js:3:8651)

[Error] Failed to load resource: The operation couldn’t be completed. Protocol error
{code}
h3. Notes
 * Occasionally (say 1 in 10), the pages are properly rendered. So this might depends on resource loading timing, etc.
 * This happens to Confluence Cloud as well

h3. Workaround

Use another browser such as Google Chrome.
fields.summary: Safari fails to render add-on pages

fields.description:
As frustrations with this error [continue to persist|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/You-cannot-perform-this-operation-on-a-draft-workflow/qaq-p/133114#M234561], it might be helpful to better-steer users to helpful solutions in the following ways:
 * Change the [More Information|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/working-with-workflows-861253510.html#ConfiguringWorkflow-Limitationswheneditinganactiveworkflow] link on this error to [the other link that should have been used|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/cannot-add-transitions-or-delete-steps-in-draft-workflows-203392961.html]
 * Remove the sentence "*When you edit an active workflow, JIRA first creates a draft of it, that you can then modify +_as you see fit_+*" from the [More Information|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/working-with-workflows-861253510.html#ConfiguringWorkflow-Limitationswheneditinganactiveworkflow] page, as "as you see fit" is not true and multiple-year old problems persist e.g. JRACLOUD-17782.
 * Outline the (8-step) workaround required to add status/transitions to a default workflow (since modifying the default workflow is not possible due to it being active upon project setup):
 ** navigate to workflows
 ** duplicate the current workflow
 ** change the name of the duplicated workflow (but you can't use the active workflow name and can't change the active workflow name, so you are forced to use something entirely different)
 ** add the status/transition
 ** navigate to the workflow scheme
 ** change the workflow in the scheme
 ** navigate back to workflows
 ** delete the default workflow
fields.summary: As an admin, when adding transitions or deleting steps on an active workflow, I want improved guidance to the error message "You cannot perform this operation on a draft workflow"

fields.description:
Can you add approval functionality to the Jira app?

 

The mobile app cannot be used with any issues that require approvals.

This is causing a usability issue for us in service desk as many of our users prefer mobile access.

It creates a compliance issue where you cannot approve the ticket where approvals are required,

The approval, a vital part of the workflow is not possible via the mobile app.
fields.summary: Mobile App doesn't work for any of the issue types "...with Approvals"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the new UI for Jira, ADG3, when managing dashboards in Jira, there is no option to organize the dashboards listed there in a custom sort method.   This was something that you could do in ADG2.
While you can sort by favorite, name, owner, or popularity, these are only then sorted alphabetically either ascending or descending.  There is no option to create a customized order as to how these appear on the list of dashboards.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow users to custom sort these by bringing back the up/down buttons.   I imagine there could be some unseen ordered number list that corresponds to each dashboard entry that would updated when changing these.  This could be thought of as an additional column called something like 'custom order'.   Since the new ADG3 seems to offer more, but different ways to sort, we obviously don't want to lose the new features in the process of implementing this one, but by the same token, we would want to be able to sort in a custom method as well.


h3. Why this is important
This is something that ADG2 had.  As you can see from the buttons, there are up/down buttons that could be used to change the order of the dashboards.   When you have a lot of dashboards, it becomes really important to have different ways to sort these in order to be able to organize your information and navigate to it quickly.  I realize my example here only shows 2 dashboard entries, but imagine this with several dozen dashboards instead. 

*ADG2 dashboard:*
 !dashboardorder.png|thumbnail! 

*ADG3 dashboard*
 !dashnewUI.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: New UI should allow users to custom sort the order of dashboards when managing

fields.description: The screens list on the View Screens page (secure/admin/ViewFieldScreens.jspa) lost sorting, making it hard to find required screen.
fields.summary: Screens list on the View Screens page (secure/admin/ViewFieldScreens.jspa) lost sorting

fields.description:
When you want to upload an attachment in Jira Cloud - an image, video or a document, there are currently two 3rd party providers for uploading files:
- Google Drive
- Dropbox

Some customers have security policies in place that restrict uploading to only local resources.

There should be an option to turn off any 3rd party integrations for uploading files in JIRA Cloud or have an option to switch one of the options off.
fields.summary: Disable 3rd party services such as Dropbox from being able to upload files in JIRA Cloud.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Gadgets such as 'Average Time in Status' and 'Average Number of Times in Status' rely on the '[CHART] Time in Status' custom field. This custom field can be deleted, which breaks those gadgets.

Users, unaware of what deleting this custom field can cause, may delete it and prevent the gadgets from working.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Prevent users from deleting this field (and even maybe hiding it from the custom fields page)

h3. Workaround 
If that field was deleted, recreate it with "Time in Status" type.
fields.summary: Prevent users from deleting the [CHART] Time in Status field

fields.description:
I, as JIRA Administrators, would like to have the feature to bulk edit user accounts.
It would be good to get all the accounts and update them.
fields.summary: Bulk Edit User Accounts

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

A user can't make a different field set as required when a different field has a value

h3. Suggested Solution

Give the users an option of setting a field which is required if a certain field has value

h3. Why this is important

This gives users extra flexibility on customizing the fields on their screen.
fields.summary: Make a field required when another field has value

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When looking to an issue on the board with the new issue detail view pop-up, it's not possible to see the "Log Work" button even if you configure in the edit screen.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to a project 
# Configure the log work field to appear in the edit screen for all the issue types
# Open one of the project boards, click on an issue.

h3. Expected Results

The log work button would appear.

h3. Actual Results

The button doesn't appear.

h3. Workaround

Turn off the new issue detail view for Jira boards

h3. Note

In case you don't know how to turn off, please, check [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/the-new-jira-issue-view-938040503.html].
fields.summary: Log work button doesn't appear in the new issue detail view for boards

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently when creating an Issue Type Screen Scheme the dropdown list for Screen Schemes is *not ordered in any manner*, just like how it was displayed in the Screen Scheme list itself.
This makes things difficult when having multiple Screen Schemes as you need to find the Screen Scheme scrolling down with no possible sorting of them.

h3. Suggested Solution

Order the Screen schemes alphabetically on the drop-down down list used for the Issue Type Screen Scheme or add the option to sort them in some manner.
fields.summary: Offer the possibility to order screen schemes in alphabetical order when creating an issue type screen scheme

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In a Jira software project, when I try to add a comment or update the description of an issue from the backlog tab, the wiki style renderer is not working.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # go to backlog for a software project
 # click on an issue to view it from the side list
 # try to update description field or add a comment by adding the letter x between two parenthesis.
 # The value is not rendered

h3. Expected Results
 * the value is rendered to the icon (x)

h3. Actual Results
 * The value is not rendered and a backslash is added before the parenthesis.
 * You just need to access the issue directly and click on the pen to discover that a backslash was added: 
 * ----
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
----

h3. Workaround

Deactivate the lab feature was the suggested solution for one customer.
fields.summary: Wiki Style Renderer error with Lab feature activated

fields.description: As an admin, I want to be able to sort the Screens list on the View Screens page (secure/admin/ViewFieldScreens.jspa) by Name, Screen schemes or Workflows for better navigation.
fields.summary: As an admin, I want to be able to sort the Screens list on the View Screens page

fields.description: I, was an JIRA Admin, would like to allow people to create their own users (existing employees who may not have a Confluence or JIRA Software user yet) but to restrict the accounts they can use to "username@domain.com"
fields.summary: Create Own Account with Restrict Domain

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Runs a JQL query and tries to aggroup the results by a common field such as fixVersion or sprint. This functionality may act like the GROUP BY clause from SQL. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Give JQL the ability to create reports grouped by a given field as the GROUP BY clause from SQL.
 
h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Missing GROUP_BY clause in the pseudo sql filter language

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In some cases, some tickets may fail to be edited in core board view. 

Issue quick view (https://instance.atlassian.net/browse/KEY-1) is not affected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Find an affected ticket in core board
# Click it so a pop-up windows appear
!Screenshot Jira.jpg|thumbnail!
# Edit something
# Click 'Save'

h3. Expected Results
The ticket is saved.

h3. Actual Results
Save button doesn't respond.

We can see this error in JS Console and Jira logs:
{noformat}
RangeError: Invalid content for node listItem
    at f.createChecked (https://jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/async-issue-view.446472b5daafd18df4e4.5.js:1:6469293)
    at t.b (https://jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/async-issue-view.446472b5daafd18df4e4.5.js:1:1065198)
    at e.parse (https://jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/async-issue-view.446472b5daafd18df4e4.5.js:1:1053031)
    at j (https://jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/async-issue-view.446472b5daafd18df4e4.5.js:1:2433994)
    at t.value (https://jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/async-issue-view.446472b5daafd18df4e4.5.js:1:6955562)
    at d._renderValidatedComponentWithoutOwnerOrContext (https://jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/vendor.f788a36276d6fd0aab81.5.js:1:392496)
    at d._renderValidatedComponent (https://jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/vendor.f788a36276d6fd0aab81.5.js:1:392623)
    at d.performInitialMount (https://jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/vendor.f788a36276d6fd0aab81.5.js:1:388476)
    at d.mountComponent (https://jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/vendor.f788a36276d6fd0aab81.5.js:1:387522)
    at Object.mountComponent (https://jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/vendor.f788a36276d6fd0aab81.5.js:1:440610)	
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
Open ticket in quick view and edit there.
fields.summary: Some tickets cannot be edited in business boards view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When Trello board is imported on Jira, the workflow created step with id 0

h3. Suggested Solution
Start the step counter with id 1

h3. Why this is important
This causes the bug https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-16620

h3. Workaround 
- On workflow, remove the status related to the step with id 0
- Add the status back and recreate the post-functions/validators/properties/conditions
fields.summary: Avoid the creation of workflows containing step with id 0
Activity order arrow icon not clear

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using Safari, the _Permission Violation_ error is shown on a few pages even if the user has permission to view it.

h3. Environment
* Safari 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate through Jira pages until the error is shown

h3. Expected Results
If the customer has permission on the project/issue then it's displayed

h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
Permission Violation
Sorry, you don't have permission to perform that action. If you think you should have permission, contact your administrator.
You can also switch accounts if you want to use a different email address.
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
- Try browser troubleshooting:
-- Clear cache
-- Disable extensions
-- Enable third party cookies

For a few users the browser troubleshooting doesn't help so we recommend the usage of Chrome or Firefox.
fields.summary: Permission Violation error on a few pages

fields.description:
I, as JIRA user, would like to create custom fields with tree-like structures instead of single-level drop downs - like in the below image.

 !Tree-Dropdown-Directive.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Tree-Like Dropdown List

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the *configure custom field* page if an option different from *Any issue type* is selected for issue type(s) it will not appear on the page.


Environment

Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to *Custom Fields*.
 # On a custom field select *Configure*.
 # On the *Configure Custom Field* page click *Edit Configuration* for the configuration scheme of the field.
 # On the *Issue types* options select any option other than "Any issue type" and click *Modify*.
 !Screen Shot 2018-01-31 at 18.31.58.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

On the *Configure Custom Field* page the *Issue type(s):* should display the option(s) you have selected.

h3. Actual Results

No issue type is displayed.
 !Screen Shot 2018-01-31 at 18.32.16.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
Only "any issue types" is displayed if selected.
  !Screen Shot 2018-01-31 at 18.32.49.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: When configuring a custom field if a issue type is selected, other than "Any issue type" it will not appear on the page.

fields.description:
For example entering "android bug backlog" does not show any results in the quick search view... but hitting enter and going to the JQL search screen properly parses into the JQL query and displays results.

Would be nice if results were displayed in the quick search properly.
fields.summary: Show issues directly from the quick search view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The function issueList("") is suggested while writing JQL searches and even though its syntax seems to be validated it doesn't affect the search at all.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access the search issues page
 # Go to the advanced mode
 # Type *"Epic Link" in* and notice that the mentioned function will appear as a suggestion:
 !function.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

This function is not mentioned in any Atlassian documentation.
JQL functions [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/advanced-searching-functions-reference-765593719.html].
fields.summary: JQL issueList function does not affect search
